field.label: Name
field.help: Name to identify this rule.

field.label: Description
field.help: Description for this rule.

field.label: Test type
field.help: Choose how to test. By using IF it tests if the condition evaluates to true. If you use UNLESS, the sense of the test is reversed.

field.label: Select conditions
field.help: Select one or more conditions to be used for this rule.

field.label: Logical operator for conditions
field.help: Choose a logical operator.

field.label: Execute function
field.help: Choose a HAProxy function that should be executed if the condition evaluates to true.

field.label: Use backend pool
field.help: HAProxy will use this backend pool if the condition evaluates to true.

field.label: Use server
field.help: HAProxy will use this server instead of other servers that are specified in the Backend Pool. The server must exist in the context where this rule is applied.

field.label: NOTE: The specified server must be present in the Backend Pool where this rule is applied.
Auth Realm
field.help: When HAProxy requests user name and password from the user, this optional authentication realm is returned with the response (typically the application's name).

field.label: HTTP Redirect
field.help: Use HAProxy's redirect function to return a HTTP redirection. See HAProxy's documentation for further details and examples.

field.label: Lua function
field.help: Execute the specified Lua function. You will most likely need to include/load your Lua code first.

field.label: Lua service
field.help: Register the specified Lua service. You will most likely need to include/load your Lua code first.

field.label: HTTP Header
field.help: Append a HTTP header field with the specified name.

field.label: Header Content
field.help: The value that should be set for the specified HTTP header. Note that it is possible to use pre-defined variables, see HAProxy's documentation for further details and examples.

field.label: HTTP Header
field.help: Remove the HTTP header field with the specified name and add a new one with the same name. This is useful when passing security information to the server, where the header must not be manipulated by external users.

field.label: Header Content
field.help: The value that should be set for the specified HTTP header. Note that it's possible to use pre-defined variables, see HAProxy's documentation for further details and examples.

field.label: HTTP Header
field.help: Remove the HTTP header field with the specified name.

field.label: HTTP Header
field.help: The name of the HTTP header field.

field.label: Regular Expression
field.help: Matches the specified regular expression in all occurrences of the header field.

field.label: HTTP Header
field.help: The name of the HTTP header field.

field.label: Regular Expression
field.help: This is suited for all header fields which are allowed to carry more than one value: Matches the specified regular expression against every comma-delimited value of the header field.

field.label: Set Path
field.help: Rewrites the request path. The query string, if any, is left intact. If a scheme and authority is found before the path, they are left intact as well.

field.label: Variable Scope
field.help: The name of the variable starts with an indication about its scope.

field.label: Expression
field.help: A standard HAProxy expression formed by a sample-fetch followed by some converters.

field.label: Lua function
field.help: Execute the specified Lua function. You will most likely need to include/load your Lua code first.

field.label: HTTP Header

field.label: HTTP Header
field.help: The name of the HTTP header field.

field.label: Regular Expression
field.help: Matches the specified regular expression in all occurrences of header field.

field.label: HTTP Status Code
field.help: Replaces the response status code. Must be an integer between 100 and 999.

field.label: HTTP Reason Text
field.help: An optional custom reason text for the HTTP status code. If empty the default reason for the specified code will be used.

field.label: Variable Scope
field.help: The name of the variable starts with an indication about its scope.

field.label: Expression
field.help: A standard HAProxy expression formed by a sample-fetch followed by some converters.

field.label: Monitoring URI
field.help: Specifies a URI which will be intercepted to return HAProxy's health status instead of forwarding the request. When a HTTP request is received, HAProxy will return either "HTTP/1.0 200 OK" or "HTTP/1.0 503 Service unavailable", depending on the fined failure conditions.

field.label: Lua function
field.help: Execute the specified Lua function. You will most likely need to include/load your Lua code first.

field.label: Lua service
field.help: Register the specified Lua service. You will most likely need to include/load your Lua code first.

field.label: TCP inspection delay
field.help: Set the maximum allowed time to wait for data during content inspection. Defaults to milliseconds. You may also enter a number followed by one of the supported suffixes "d" (days), "h" (hour), "m" (minute), "s" (seconds), "ms" (miliseconds).

field.label: Lua function
field.help: Execute the specified Lua function. You will most likely need to include/load your Lua code first.

field.label: TCP inspection delay
field.help: Set the maximum allowed time to wait for a response during content inspection. Defaults to milliseconds. You may also enter a number followed by one of the supported suffixes "d" (days), "h" (hour), "m" (minute), "s" (seconds), "ms" (miliseconds).

field.label: Option pass-through
field.help: Specify a HAProxy rule/ACL that is currently not supported by the GUI.

field.label: Map file
field.help: HAProxy will extract the Host header from the HTTP request and search the map file for a match. If a match is found, the backend pool from the map file will be used.

field.label: Default backend pool
field.help: HAProxy will use this backend pool if no match is found in the map file.

field.label: Header Name
field.help: Specify the name of a request header which will be passed to the FastCGI application. Most request headers are already available to the FastCGI application, prefixed with "HTTP_". Thus, this directive is only required to pass headers that are purposefully omitted. Currently, the headers "Authorization", "Proxy-Authorization" and hop-by-hop headers are omitted.

field.label: Parameter
field.help: Set a FastCGI parameter that should be passed to the application. Its value must follow HAProxy's Custom Log format rules. With this directive, it is possible to overwrite the value of default FastCGI parameters.
